main event: A civilian reported observing a round, silver object at high altitude for approximately 5 minutes on December 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was the size of the head of a pin and appeared stationary, It moved in a manner similar to an aircraft, Two aircraft were reported to be in the area at the time of the sighting, The report suggested the object could have been a balloon or possibly an aircraft, The sighting took place in the northwest section of Oklahoma City.
witness description: Civilian, student, member of GCC and CAP
